studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 7 - Statistical Methods & Determination of Sample Size
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Sample size increased to approximately 240 subjects to accommodate more countries and higher dropout rates.
Modified eligibility criteria to exclude subjects positive for COVID-19.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.3 - Loading Dose, Continuous Infusion Rates, Titration, and Extra Doses
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Clarified flexibility in F3 infusion rate reduction beyond the standard 20% limit.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.8 - Study Drug and Study Devices
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added guidance on cannula length selection and infusion site rotation.
Updated reporting timeframe for product complaints to 24 hours.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Necessary protocol modifications due to the COVID-19 pandemic to minimize subject risk.
To mitigate the risk of muscle wall infiltration leading to pain and/or occlusion of the cannula.
To provide general guidance to investigators on possible causes and management of hallucinations/psychosis.
To accommodate participation of additional countries and account for higher-than-expected dropout rate.

studyChanges.summary: Updated sample size estimation to 240 subjects.
Changed the reporting timeframe for product complaints to 24 hours.
Removed references to caregivers throughout protocol and Operations Manual.

studyChanges.afterText: F3 infusion rate may be reduced beyond the 20% limit from the prescribed base infusion rate (F1) if medically necessary and only with approval from the AbbVie TA MD.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified F3 infusion rate reduction protocols.
